ai.summary: Accessible Route, Dunwich Heath is a ~6.3 km moderate hike through coastal heathland in the UK. The route offers open views, sea breeze, and a steady pace suitable for walkers seeking a longer but manageable coastal outing.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly compacted sandy and grassy paths with some exposed ground. Expect a mix of short boardwalk sections and well-trodden trails; sections can be uneven or wind-swept near the heath, with occasional dune edges.
ai.safety_notes: Coastal weather can change rapidly. Wear sturdy footwear and bring layers, a waterproof jacket, and sun protection. Stay on marked paths to protect the delicate heath and avoid soft dune areas. Carry water and a charged phone; mobile signal may be limited in remote parts of the heath.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation on your phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn are ideal, when the heath is in bloom and trails are drier; winter visits can be windy and muddy.
